business.headline: Is the defence stock party over? Here's what investors need to knowShares of Paras Defence and Cochin Shipyard dropped more than 6% each during the day. The broader Nifty India Defence index was also down.

Lost your UAN? Here's a step-by-step guide to get it back in minutesYour UAN is more than just a number. Without your UAN, you can't check your PF balance, update your account, or even withdraw money when you need it.

Paras Defence, Cochin Shipyard: Why these defence stocks tumbled over 6% todayLeading the slide were Paras Defence, Cochin Shipyard. Both fell over 6% in intraday trade. The broader Nifty India Defence index dropped 1.4% to around 11:50 am, marking its second straight day of decline after a blistering multi-week rally.

ITR checklist: Who must file, deadlines, documents and the truth about 'zero tax'In the 2025–26 Union Budget, the government gave a big relief, i.e., no tax on income up to Rs 12 lakh under the new tax regime. But here's the catch: You must file your ITR to claim it.

Explained: Why Protean eGov shares are in free fallAfter crashing 20% on Monday, the stock fell another 13% in early trade, briefly hovering near the Rs 995 mark—perilously close to its 52-week low of Rs 930.
Pfizer share price rises 12% today. Here's whyPfizer stock: The stock jumped 11.91% during the day to touch a high of Rs 4,995.85 on the stock exchanges, after starting the day at Rs 4,698.80.

Explained: How Bangladesh is hurting itself by curbing Indian exportsIndia's new import rules sharply limit Bangladesh's access through Northeast land ports, forcing key goods onto restricted sea routes. The move comes after Bangladesh imposed similar restrictions on Indian goods.

Forget crypto, gold and stocks: Why India's ultra-rich are buying landA luxury real estate advisor has said that India's top 0.001%, from unicorn founders to legacy dynasties, are quietly building Rs 75–500 crore portfolios, but not in stocks or crypto. Their focus is on land and branded real estate.
Sensex opens 150 points up, Nifty below 25,000; Tata Steel gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 150.58 points to 82,210.00, while the NSE Nifty50 added 20.45 points to 24,965.90 as of 9:25 am.

Borana Weaves IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe? Check latest GMPThe company aims to raise Rs 144.89 crore through a fresh issue of 67 lakh shares. Borana Weaves IPO will remain open for three days and will close on Thursday, May 22, 2025.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty rise or fall today?Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) sold shares worth Rs 525.95 crore, which added pressure on stock prices. This selling by investors was one of the reasons why the market fell slightly on Monday.

Stocks to watch on May 20: BEL, IndusInd Bank, RVNL, BEL, DLFMarkets ended lower in the last session. This decline came after global markets reacted to Moody's decision to lower the credit rating of the United States. However, mid-cap and small-cap stocks continued to do wel.

entertainment.headline: I'm a citizen too: Ridhi Dogra after being bullied for opposing Abir Gulaal releaseActor Ridhi Dogra recently revealed that she was bullied on social media for opposing her film 'Abir Gulaal's' release following the Pahalgam terror attack.

Ulaganayagan to Vinveli Nayaga: Kamal Haasan's on Thug Life, death and legacyKamal Haasan is upbeat about his upcoming film, 'Thug Life', which marks his reunion with Mani Ratnam 37 years after their iconic 'Nayakan'. In a chat with India Today, he spoke in detail about the film, among several other topics.

Denzel Washington receives honorary Palme d'Or at Cannes: Blessed beyond measureHollywood actor Denzel Washington received the prestigious Honorary Palme d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival during the premiere of his new film 'Highest 2 Lowest'.

Tom Cruise hints at end of Mission Impossible The Final ReckoningTom Cruise has hinted that 'Mission Impossible: The Final Reckoning' could mark the end of the iconic franchise. The new title and his recent comments have fuelled speculation about Ethan Hunt's final mission.

Paresh Rawal demanded Rs 25 crore for Hera Pheri 3: The real reason behind his exitParesh Rawal demanded Rs 25 crore for his role as Babu Rao Apte in 'Hera Pheri 3', following which he made an exit from the franchise. This irked Akshay Kumar, who has now decided to take legal action against him.

War 2 teaser: No mercy, only guns do the talking in Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR's film'War 2' teaser starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR was released on May 20. The film, directed by Ayan Mukerji, will release in theatres on August 14.

Did Shraddha Kapoor quit Rahi Anil's film over Rs 17 crore fee? Director reactsReports claim Shraddha Kapoor exited director Rahi Anil Barve's upcoming thriller film produced by Ekta Kapoor after allegedly demanding a Rs 17 crore fee. However, director Barve dismissed these claims as mere rumours.

Janhvi Kapoor's boyfriend Shikhar, sister Khushi become her cheerleaders at CannesActor Janhvi Kapoor is set to walk the Cannes red carpet for her film 'Homebound' screening. Ahead of the grand appearance, the actor received a shout-out from her squad, who accompanied her to the French Riviera.

Raid 2 box office: Ajay's film hits Rs 200 crore worldwide, 2nd after ChhaavaAjay Devgn's 'Raid 2' has entered the Rs 200 crore club at the worldwide box office. The film has also breached the Rs 150 crore nett mark back home. It is only the second Bollywood film this year after 'Chhaava' to have achieved the feat.

Priyanka Chopra rocks beige outfit at Italy event with Lisa and Liu YifeiPriyanka Chopra looked gorgeous in a beige outfit as she attended the Bulgari event with Blackpink's Lisa and Liu Yifei. Several photos from the event have gone viral.

Mission Impossible 8 box office Day 3: Tom Cruise's film sees big drop on MondayWhile 'Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning' opened on a strong note at the Indian box office on Saturday, the film saw a huge drop on its first Monday. It is still looking at gathering solid numbers towards the second weekend.

Sharmila Tagore, Simi Garewal attend Cannes screening of Ray's Aranyer Din RatriVeteran actors Sharmila Tagore and Simi Garewal attended the screening of Satyajit Ray's iconic film, 'Aranyer Din Ratri.' The pictures of the two walking the red carpet with the team have gone viral.

Rajamouli recommends Tourist Family after a glowing review. Director reactsDirector SS Rajamouli showered appreciation on the Tamil film, 'Tourist Family', starring Sasikumar and Simran. Debutant director Abishan Jeevinth was over the moon after the 'RRR' director called his film the best cinematic experience of the year.

Tamil actors Vishal, Sai Dhanshika announce wedding in AugustTamil actors Vishal and Sai Dhanshika made their relationship official at 'Yogi Da' event in Chennai on Monday. The two will get married in August.

'Sesame Street' heads to Netflix while staying on PBSSesame Street will stream new and classic episodes on Netflix later this year, while continuing its run on PBS. Season 56 will feature shorter, story-driven episodes and fresh visual updates.

Billie Eilish Tour 2025: New dates, Austin concerts, and ticket infoBillie Eilish has added 23 new shows to her 2025 tour, including Austin, Texas. The expanded tour spans Japan and the US, and tickets will be available from May 22.

'Dilbert' creator Scott Adams diagnosed with same prostate cancer as Joe Biden"Dilbert" creator Scott Adams announced he has advanced prostate cancer, similar to Joe Biden's. He expects to live only a few more months and continues updating fans despite constant pain.

Dawn Richard testifies Diddy threatened her after witnessing Cassie attackDawn Richard testified that Diddy threatened her after she saw him abuse Cassie. Cassie's ex-roommate also detailed alleged assaults, NDAs, and financial control in the ongoing federal trial.

Rajinikanth to team up with director Vivek Athreya for his next: ReportTelugu director Vivek Athreya, known for 'Brochevarevarura' and 'Saripodhaa Sanivaaram,' is reportedly in talks with Superstar Rajinikanth for his next film, likely to be produced by Mythri Movie Makers.

general news.headline: 'Spy' YouTuber established contacts up to 'terror hub' Pak-Afghan borderJyoti Malhotra, a Haryana-based travel vlogger, is among 11 people who have been arrested on charges of spying for Pakistan.

Top Army officer says India can strike all of Pak: They'll need deep hole to hideThe entire territory of Pakistan is within India's strike range, and if the Pakistani Army relocates its headquarters, it would need to find a very deep hole to hide, a top Indian Army officer underscored India's military prowess.

Interim order in Waqf law case? Key Supreme Court hearing beginsWaqf law hearing: It was decided in the last hearing that only five leading petitions would be heard from among the raft of pleas filed against the law, which expands the government's role in regulating Waqf properties.

Golden Temple gave rare go-ahead to deploy guns to counter Pak drones: OfficerIn an unprecedented move, the chief religious official of the Golden Temple permitted the Indian Army to deploy air defence systems within the shrine's premises to counter Pakistani drone and missile attacks amid India's Operation Sindoor.

How India will bypass Bangladesh roads and roadblocksAfter Bangladeshi interim leader Muhammad Yunus referred to India's "landlocked" Northeast during a China visit, New Delhi responded by restricting Bangladeshi exports and fast-tracking alternative connectivity plans for the Northeast, bypassing Bangladesh. The key to that is the Kaladan Multi-Modal Transit Project, which will link Kolkata with Mizoram via Myanmar.

Bengaluru man's Rs 50 lakh notice to civic body for 'trauma' due to poor roadsA 43-year-old Bengaluru man has served BBMP a legal notice seeking Rs 50 lakh compensation for physical and emotional trauma allegedly caused by poorly maintained roads. He linked his health issues to daily commutes.

3-year law practice mandatory to join judicial service: Supreme CourtThe Supreme Court reinstated the requirement of a minimum of three years of legal practice for candidates applying for entry-level judicial posts, noting that the lack of practical experience among judges has led to various issues.

Bengaluru rain: Elderly man, 12-year-old boy electrocuted in flooded apartmentFollowing heavy rains in Bengaluru, two people died in the BTM Layout area while trying to clear waterlogging in their apartment complex. A 35-year-old woman died in Whitefield after a compound wall collapsed.

Paresh Rawal demanded Rs 25 crore for Hera Pheri 3: The real reason behind his exitParesh Rawal demanded Rs 25 crore for his role as Babu Rao Apte in 'Hera Pheri 3', following which he made an exit from the franchise. This irked Akshay Kumar, who has now decided to take legal action against him.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

LSG's Digvesh Rathi suspended after on-field spat with Abhishek SharmaLSG's Digvesh Rathi received a one-match suspension and a 50 percent match fee fine after his on-field spat with SRH's Abhishek Sharma, who was also penalised with a 25 percent fine following the heated IPL 2025 exchange.

No booze, no cigarettes: China orders officials to cut costs amid economic strainThe effort is being seen as a measure by Xi Jinping and the Communist party to improve the economic conditions and reduce stress on the government's finances.

Forget crypto, gold and stocks: Why India's ultra-rich are buying landA luxury real estate advisor has said that India's top 0.001%, from unicorn founders to legacy dynasties, are quietly building Rs 75–500 crore portfolios, but not in stocks or crypto. Their focus is on land and branded real estate.

How Rahul Gandhi is stirring the poll pot in BiharThe Congress is making a concerted push to reclaim lost ground in Bihar. Central to its strategy is Rahul's visible involvement in the assembly election campaign

PSA for prostate cancer: Must-do medical tests men over 40 should not skipRoutine health check-ups are essential for men over 40 in India to detect silent diseases early. Early screenings can improve health outcomes and reduce long-term costs.

Hand over Hafiz Saeed, things will be over: Indian diplomat's message to PakIndia's envoy to Israel says Operation Sindoor is paused, not over. He urges Pakistan to extradite 26/11 terrorists and warns that cross-border terror will be met with continued offensive action.

War 2 teaser: No mercy, only guns do the talking in Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR's film'War 2' teaser starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR was released on May 20. The film, directed by Ayan Mukerji, will release in theatres on August 14.

NCP's Chhagan Bhujbal returns to Maharashtra cabinet, replaces Dhananjay MundeVeteran NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal was inducted into Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis's cabinet, filling the vacancy created by Dhananjay Munde's resignation.

ISI-backed Khalistani module busted in Punjab, 6 Babbar Khalsa operatives caughtThe arrested terrorists had direct links with their foreign handlers, including those operating from Portugal, and their activities were allegedly backed by Pak's spy agency.

Explained: How Bangladesh is hurting itself by curbing Indian exportsIndia's new import rules sharply limit Bangladesh's access through Northeast land ports, forcing key goods onto restricted sea routes. The move comes after Bangladesh imposed similar restrictions on Indian goods.

The day they killed an Olympic hockey champion: Prithipal SinghOn this day in 1983, three-time Olympic medallist Prithipal Singh was murdered in broad daylight in the sprawling campus of the Punjab Agriculture University, Ludhiana, sending shockwaves throughout the country.

Youtuber Manish Kashyap beaten up by junior doctors in Patna, hospitalised The BJP leader and Youtuber allegedly got into a dispute with a female junior doctor, leading to an escalated response by the junior doctors.

What is Take it Down Act that targets revenge porn? Explained in 5 pointsThe Take It Down Act, signed into law by President Trump, criminalises non-consensual sharing of intimate images, including AI deepfakes, and requires platforms to remove such content within 48 hours. Here is all you need to know about it.

Russia, Ukraine to immediately start ceasefire talks: Trump after call with PutinUS President Donald Trump said that Russia and Ukraine will immediately start talks on a ceasefire. He said that around 5,000 soldiers are killed every week in the Russia-Ukraine conflict.

sports.headline: US Open's Ashe Stadium to undergo 800 million dollars transformationThe United States Tennis Association has self-funded the massive 800 million dollars project to transform and modernise the famed Arthur Ashe Stadium.

Battered Chennai, Rajasthan look to avoid wooden spoon finishIPL 2025, CSK vs RR: MS Dhoni's Chennai Super Kings and Sanju Samson's Rajasthan Royals will be looking for a win in a game that has no bearing as far as qualification for the playoffs is concerned.

MI rope in Bairstow, Gleeson and Asalanka as overseas replacementsMumbai Indians have signed Jonny Bairstow, Richard Gleeson, and Charith Asalanka as overseas replacements for players departing due to national duty. The trio will be available only if MI qualifies for the IPL 2025 playoffs.

The day they killed an Olympic hockey champion: Prithipal SinghOn this day in 1983, three-time Olympic medallist Prithipal Singh was murdered in broad daylight in the sprawling campus of the Punjab Agriculture University, Ludhiana, sending shockwaves throughout the country.

LSG's Digvesh Rathi suspended after on-field spat with Abhishek SharmaLSG's Digvesh Rathi received a one-match suspension and a 50 percent match fee fine after his on-field spat with SRH's Abhishek Sharma, who was also penalised with a 25 percent fine following the heated IPL 2025 exchange.

LSG's Nicholas Pooran fumes in dressing room after costly run-out vs SRHLSG star batter Nicholas Pooran was seen furious after his run-out in the final over. His reaction reflected LSG's heartbreak as SRH chased down the 206-run target and ended LSG's IPL 2025 playoff hopes.

Losing close games made the difference: Marsh on LSG's IPL 2025 exitIPL 2025: Mitchell Marsh said that Lucknow Super Giants were not helped in their campaign after losing close matches. On Monday, LSG made an exit from the tournament after their six-wicket defeat to the Sunrisers Hyderabad.

Saurabh Tiwary, Shahbaz Nadeem elected as JSCA secretary and joint secretaryFormer Indian cricketers Saurabh Tiwary and Shahbaz Nadeem have been appointed as secretary and joint secretary, respectively, of the Jharkhand State Cricket Association.

Rishabh Pant will be back: Marsh backs LSG skipper for strong comebackIPL 2025: Mitchell Marsh has backed Rishabh Pant to bounce back in Lucknow Super Giants' last two matches after LSG crashed out of the tournament following their six-wicket defeat to SRH on Monday.

SRH used to Abhishek Sharma taking on early challenge: Coach Daniel VettoriAbhishek Sharma's power-packed fifty ensured SRH finished strong against LSG, showing flashes of brilliance that coach Daniel Vettori believes are integral to the franchise's future, even in a season short on consistency.

With wheels falling off, Delhi Capitals back in familiar IPL blackhole againA 10-wicket loss to Gujarat Titans has pushed Delhi Capitals down to fifth place, outside the playoff spots, with 13 points from 12 matches. Delhi began the season strong but lost momentum midway due to poor tactics, underused players, and sloppy fielding. Now, they face a do-or-die battle to keep their playoff hopes alive.

Delhi began the season strong but lost momentum midway due to poor tactics, underused players, and sloppy fielding. Now, they face a do-or-die battle to keep their playoff hopes alive.

Retain fully fit players next time: Kaif's scathing verdict on LSGFormer cricketer Mohammad Kaif has criticised LSG's team-building strategy, urging the franchise to prioritise fitness over star power after their IPL 2025 playoff exit. Injuries to key bowlers like Mayank Yadav and Mohsin Khan played a major role in the team's poor second-half showing.

MS Dhoni vs Vaibhav Suryavanshi: New Delhi set for IPL's oldest vs youngestIPL 2025: MS Dhoni is set to play what could be one of his final IPL matches in New Delhi as CSK face RR in a dead-rubber clash. The spotlight also shines on 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi, who will take on the CSK captain in a rare oldest-vs-youngest IPL showdown.

Nightmares end: Pant should have faith despite poor IPL, says ChopraFormer cricketer Aakash Chopra has urged Rishabh Pant to have faith in what is turning out to be a difficult patch in his career. Pant is not only out of the ODI team, but has fallen into a terrible spiral in the IPL 2025 as well.

UAE chase record 206 in Sharjah, beat Bangladesh for first time in T20I cricketUAE vs Bangladesh, 2nd T20I: The UAE pulled off their highest-ever T20I chase to beat Bangladesh for the first time in T20I cricket. Captain Muhammad Waseem led from the front with a blistering 82 in Sharjah.

Rishabh Pant blames unsettled bowling unit after early exit from IPL 2025Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain Rishabh Pant has blamed the team's unsettled bowling unit following their early exit from the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025). LSG got out of the playoffs race after a six-wicket loss against Sunrisers Hyderabad.

SunRisers burst LSG's bubble, leave Pant's playoff dreams in tattersRishabh Pant's Lucknow Super Giants were knocked out of the IPL 2025 after a terrible show against SunRisers Hyderabad on Monday, May 19. Abhishek Sharma and Eshan Malinga combined to hand LSG a 6-wicket defeat at the Ekana Stadium in Lucknow.

Out of form Rishabh Pant must play on instinct and not to prove a point: Aaron FinchFormer Australia cricketer Aaron Finch has said that Rishabh Pant has looked completely out of rhythm in the ongoing Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) and advised him to play on instincts instead of proving a point.

Watch: Abhishek Sharma loses cool after Digvesh Rathi's signature send-offIPL 2025, LSG vs SRH: SunRisers Hyderabad opener Abhishek Sharma was involved in a tense face-off with Digvesh Rathi after the Lucknow Super Giants spinner gave him a send-off in his trademark style.

Disappointed Pooran ready to lead LSG's charge after much-needed breakNicholas Pooran said that he was ready to lead Lucknow Super Giants' charge after a much-needed IPL break. The team aims to regain momentum and secure a playoffs spot despite recent setbacks.

Harshal Patel faster than Lasith Malinga to take 150 wickets in IPL historyIndia and Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) seamer Harhsal Patel became the fastest bowler to take 150 wickets in IPL history as he left Lasith Malinga and Yuzvendra Chahal behind in the list.

LSG vs SRH: Eshan Malinga's stunning catch compounds Rishabh Pant's horror showIPL 2025: Rishabh Pant was dismissed for 7 in Lucknow Super Giant's match against SunRisers Hyderabad in Lucknow. Eshan Malinga took a stunning return catch to add to Pant's woes on Monday, May 19.

2 drops, 1 stumping missed: Fans call out Kishan's horror show vs LSGIshan Kishan dropped crucial catches during SRH's match against Lucknow Super Giants. His errors impacted the game and drew sharp criticism from fans.

MS Dhoni in IPL 2026? Coach Stephen Fleming tight-lipped about CSK great's futureIPL 2025: Chennai Super KIngs head coach Stephen Fleming was asked about MS Dhoni's future in the tournament ahead of their match against Rajasthan Royals in Delhi. Dhoni, 43, will lead CSK in their last two league games of the season.

Gary Lineker quits BBC after major social media controversyGary Lineker has stepped down from the BBC following backlash over a controversial social media post. His departure ends a significant broadcasting era.

Ranji Trophy record-breaker Harsh Dubey makes IPL debut for SunRisers HyderabadIPL 2025, LSG vs SRH: SunRisers Hyderabad handed an IPL debut to 22-year-old left-arm spinner Harsh Dubey. The Vidarbha cricketer broke an all-time Ranji Trophy record in the 2024-25 season.

Construction of Gorakhpur International Cricket Stadium beginsThe construction work of the international cricket stadium has begun in Gorakhpur, which is one of Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's dream projects. The stadium is expected to be completed within 18 months on a 50-acre site at Tal Nadaur, Gorakhpur, with an estimated investment of Rs 236.40 crore.

SRH's Travis Head misses out, Will O'Rourke makes his IPL debut for LSGSRH all-rounder Harsh Dubey and LSG pacer Will O'Rourke made their Indian Premier League debuts during the group-stage clash in Lucknow. SunRisers Hyderabad made two changes to their playing XI, with Travis Head and Jaydev Unadkat missing out.

Hockey India starts player registration for Hero Hockey India League 2026Hockey India on May 19 announced that the registrations for the Hockey India League 2026 is now open. The closing date for the registrations for the new season is on August 20.

Rohit Sharma gives away his Lamborghini to fantasy cricket contest winnerMumbai Indians opener Rohit Sharma gifted his prized Lamborghini Urus to a fantasy cricket contest winner. The giveaway fulfilled Rohit's viral promise, given at the start of the season.

LSG vs SRH Highlights: Abhishek Sharma, Klaasen guide Hyderabad to 6-wicket winLSG vs SRH, IPL 2025 Highlights: Sunrisers Hyderabad have beaten Lucknow Super Giants by six wickets as they chased down 206 in 18.2 overs. Abhishek Sharma (59 off 20) and Heinrich Klaasen (47 off 28) top-scored for their team.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
